The Four Seasons has taken Netflix by storm this May, captivating audiences with its perfect 10/10 rating. This brilliant comedy series, inspired by a 1980s cult classic, has quickly climbed to the top of Netflix's most-watched list. Comedy lovers are already clamoring for a second season of this refreshingly witty show created by comedy powerhouse Tina Fey. Netflix has struck gold with their latest comedy offering that premiered on May 1st, 2025. In just a matter of days, The Four Seasons has emerged as the platform's standout success, earning perfect ratings and drawing viewers in with its smart writing and stellar cast. This reimagining of a beloved 80s film has resonated with audiences seeking quality comedy amidst the sea of dramas and thrillers dominating streaming platforms today. Comedy dream team behind Netflix's newest hit The Four Seasons brings together an exceptional ensemble of talent both behind and in front of the camera. At the helm is comedy veteran Tina Fey, who serves as creator, writer, and lead actress. Her previous successes with 30 Rock and Mean Girls have established her reputation for crafting intelligent, character-driven comedy. Joining Fey is a remarkable cast including Steve Carell of The Office fame and the versatile Colman Domingo. This powerhouse trio delivers performances that critics are calling “perfectly balanced” and “genuinely hilarious.” Their chemistry elevates the show's already sharp dialogue to new heights. What sets this series apart is how it tackles relationship complexities with both humor and heart. Unlike many contemporary comedies that rely on shock value, The Four Seasons employs: Sophisticated character development Witty, authentic dialogue Relatable relationship dynamics Thoughtful exploration of adult friendships The production quality matches the writing excellence, with beautiful cinematography capturing the seasonal settings and a soundtrack that complements the emotional undertones of each episode perfectly. Fresh take on relationships earning perfect scores The premise of The Four Seasons follows three married couples who vacation together every season in New York. The narrative catalyst occurs when one couple announces their divorce, triggering a chain reaction of soul-searching among the remaining friends. What unfolds is a thoughtful examination of modern relationships that avoids clichés while maintaining genuine humor. Critics have praised the series for its refreshing approach to adult friendships and romantic partnerships. Unlike many comedy shows that portray relationships as either idealized or hopelessly dysfunctional, The Four Seasons presents a nuanced view of how people grow together and apart over time. Viewers particularly appreciate how the show tackles sensitive themes without becoming melodramatic. The Four Seasons manages to be reflective without being preachy, allowing audiences to contemplate their own relationships while still being thoroughly entertained. The Four Seasons has taken Netflix by storm this May, captivating audiences with its perfect 10/10 rating. This brilliant comedy series, inspired by a 1980s cult classic, has quickly climbed to the top of Netflix's most-watched list. Comedy lovers are already clamoring for a second season of this refreshingly witty show created by comedy powerhouse Tina Fey.

Netflix has struck gold with their latest comedy offering that premiered on May 1st, 2025. In just a matter of days, The Four Seasons has emerged as the platform's standout success, earning perfect ratings and drawing viewers in with its smart writing and stellar cast. This reimagining of a beloved 80s film has resonated with audiences seeking quality comedy amidst the sea of dramas and thrillers dominating streaming platforms today.

Comedy dream team behind Netflix's newest hit

The Four Seasons brings together an exceptional ensemble of talent both behind and in front of the camera. At the helm is comedy veteran Tina Fey, who serves as creator, writer, and lead actress. Her previous successes with 30 Rock and Mean Girls have established her reputation for crafting intelligent, character-driven comedy.

Joining Fey is a remarkable cast including Steve Carell of The Office fame and the versatile Colman Domingo. This powerhouse trio delivers performances that critics are calling “perfectly balanced” and “genuinely hilarious.” Their chemistry elevates the show's already sharp dialogue to new heights.

What sets this series apart is how it tackles relationship complexities with both humor and heart. Unlike many contemporary comedies that rely on shock value, The Four Seasons employs:

  • Sophisticated character development
  • Witty, authentic dialogue
  • Relatable relationship dynamics
  • Thoughtful exploration of adult friendships

The production quality matches the writing excellence, with beautiful cinematography capturing the seasonal settings and a soundtrack that complements the emotional undertones of each episode perfectly.

Fresh take on relationships earning perfect scores

The premise of The Four Seasons follows three married couples who vacation together every season in New York. The narrative catalyst occurs when one couple announces their divorce, triggering a chain reaction of soul-searching among the remaining friends. What unfolds is a thoughtful examination of modern relationships that avoids clichés while maintaining genuine humor.

Critics have praised the series for its refreshing approach to adult friendships and romantic partnerships. Unlike many comedy shows that portray relationships as either idealized or hopelessly dysfunctional, The Four Seasons presents a nuanced view of how people grow together and apart over time.

Viewers particularly appreciate how the show tackles sensitive themes without becoming melodramatic. The Four Seasons manages to be reflective without being preachy, allowing audiences to contemplate their own relationships while still being thoroughly entertained.

Why audiences can't get enough of this perfect 10/10 comedy

Since its release, The Four Seasons has maintained an unprecedented perfect score on Netflix's rating system. This remarkable achievement reflects its universal appeal across different demographics. Both younger viewers and mature audiences find something meaningful in its portrayal of friendship and love.

What makes the series so compelling is its careful balance of comedy and emotional depth. It offers:

  1. Laugh-out-loud moments that never feel forced
  2. Emotional revelations that resonate with real-life experiences
  3. Character growth that feels earned rather than contrived
  4. Situations that prompt viewers to reflect on their own relationships

The show's structure, revisiting the same friend group across different seasons, provides a clever framework for exploring how relationships evolve over time. Each seasonal setting reflects the emotional climate of the characters, adding visual metaphor to the narrative.

For fans seeking quality comedy that doesn't sacrifice substance, The Four Seasons delivers on all fronts. Its perfect rating speaks to how well the show has captured what audiences crave: intelligent humor, authentic characters, and stories that feel both entertaining and meaningful.

As viewers finish binging the first season, the overwhelming demand for more episodes signals that Netflix has found a genuine hit. Whether you're watching solo or with your partner, The Four Seasons offers a delightful blend of humor and heart that proves truly exceptional comedy series can still thrive in today's crowded streaming landscape.
